definitions.title: n. sufficiency
definitions.body: (der. obscure: Aram. [[מִיסַּת]], mesat, common in Targum SyrVer, both absol. and cstr. in sense of sufficiency, enough; e.g. for Heb. [[רַב]] 2Sa 24:16 Targum, [[דַּי]] Ex 36:7 Targum SyrVer, Ob:Ob 5 Targum SyrVer, for [[לְפִי]] Ex 12:4 Targum; mesat h.uwbto0 the amount of the debt, PS:2183);—De 16:10 and thou shalt keep the pilgrimage of weeks [[מִסַּת נִדְבַת יָֽדְְ]] acc. to (adv. acc.) the sufficiency of the free-will offering of thy hand, which thou shalt give, i.e. with the full amount that thou canst afford (cf. [[דֵּי שֶׂשׁה]] Le 5:7, Le 12:8; Targum [[כְּמִיסַּת אִימְּרָא]]).
